segment.source: Evaluating MBAM 2.5 in a Test Environment
segment.target: Evaluating MBAM 2.5 in a Test Environment

segment.source: Evaluating MBAM 2.5 in a Test Environment
segment.target: Evaluating MBAM 2.5 in a Test Environment

segment.source: Evaluating MBAM 2.5 in a Test Environment
segment.target: Evaluating MBAM 2.5 in a Test Environment

segment.source: This topic describes how you can set up a test environment to evaluate Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) 2.5 in the Stand-alone or System Center Configuration Manager Integration topology.
segment.target: This topic describes how you can set up a test environment to evaluate Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) 2.5 in the Stand-alone or System Center Configuration Manager Integration topology.

segment.source: Evaluating MBAM 2.5 by using the Stand-alone topology
segment.target: Evaluating MBAM 2.5 by using the Stand-alone topology

segment.source: To evaluate MBAM by using the Stand-alone topology, use the information in the following tables to install the MBAM Server software, and then configure the MBAM Server features in your test environment.
segment.target: To evaluate MBAM by using the Stand-alone topology, use the information in the following tables to install the MBAM Server software, and then configure the MBAM Server features in your test environment.

segment.target: To evaluate MBAM 2.5 by using the Stand-alone topology

segment.source: On a client computer, do the following:
segment.target: On a client computer, do the following:

segment.source: Install the MBAM Client on a client computer.
segment.target: Install the MBAM Client on a client computer.

segment.source: Apply the MBAM Group Policy Objects (GPOs) to the computer.
segment.target: Apply the MBAM Group Policy Objects (GPOs) to the computer.

segment.source: Set the following registry keys to force the MBAM Client to wake up faster and at regular intervals:
segment.target: Set the following registry keys to force the MBAM Client to wake up faster and at regular intervals:

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Because these keys wake up the MBAM Client every minute, we recommend that you use these registry key settings only in a test environment.
segment.target: Because these keys wake up the MBAM Client every minute, we recommend that you use these registry key settings only in a test environment.

segment.source: Restart the BitLocker Management Client Service.
segment.target: Restart the BitLocker Management Client Service.

segment.source: Evaluating MBAM 2.5 by using the System Center 2012 Configuration Manager Integration topology
segment.target: Evaluating MBAM 2.5 by using the System Center 2012 Configuration Manager Integration topology

segment.source: To evaluate MBAM by using the Configuration Manager Integration topology, use the information in the following tables to install the MBAM Server software, and then configure the MBAM Server features in your test environment.
segment.target: To evaluate MBAM by using the Configuration Manager Integration topology, use the information in the following tables to install the MBAM Server software, and then configure the MBAM Server features in your test environment.

segment.source: After installing the MBAM Client on a client computer, you will complete additional steps to force the MBAM Client to report the computer’s status to MBAM more quickly.
segment.target: After installing the MBAM Client on a client computer, you will complete additional steps to force the MBAM Client to report the computer’s status to MBAM more quickly.

segment.source: To evaluate MBAM 2.5 by using the System Center 2012 Configuration Manager Integration topology
segment.target: To evaluate MBAM 2.5 by using the System Center 2012 Configuration Manager Integration topology

segment.source: Where to get instructions
segment.target: Where to get instructions

segment.source: Install the MBAM Server software on each server where you want to configure an MBAM Server feature.
segment.target: Install the MBAM Server software on each server where you want to configure an MBAM Server feature.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: You can install the databases to a remote SQL Server computer by using Windows PowerShell or an exported data-tier application (DAC) package.
segment.target: You can install the databases to a remote SQL Server computer by using Windows PowerShell or an exported data-tier application (DAC) package.

segment.source: For more information about DAC packages, see Data-tier Applications.
segment.target: For more information about DAC packages, see Data-tier Applications.

segment.source: Configure the System Center Configuration Manager to install the Configuration Manager objects.
segment.target: Configure the System Center Configuration Manager to install the Configuration Manager objects.

segment.source: How to Configure the MBAM 2.5 System Center Configuration Manager Integration
segment.target: How to Configure the MBAM 2.5 System Center Configuration Manager Integration

segment.source: On a client computer, do the following:
segment.target: On a client computer, do the following:

segment.source: Install the MBAM Client and the Configuration Manager Client on a client computer.
segment.target: Install the MBAM Client and the Configuration Manager Client on a client computer.

segment.source: Apply the MBAM Group Policy Objects to the computer.
segment.target: Apply the MBAM Group Policy Objects to the computer.

segment.source: Set the following registry keys to force the MBAM Client to wake up faster and at regular intervals:
segment.target: Set the following registry keys to force the MBAM Client to wake up faster and at regular intervals:

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Because these keys wake up the MBAM Client every minute, we recommend that you use these registry key settings only in a test environment.
segment.target: Because these keys wake up the MBAM Client every minute, we recommend that you use these registry key settings only in a test environment.

segment.source: Restart the BitLocker Management Client Service.
segment.target: Restart the BitLocker Management Client Service.

segment.source: In Control Panel, open Configuration Manager, and then click the Actions tab.
segment.target: In Control Panel, open Configuration Manager, and then click the Actions tab.

segment.source: Select Machine Policy Retrieval & Evaluation Cycle, and then click Run Now to apply the Group Policy Objects that are relevant to that client computer.
segment.target: Select Machine Policy Retrieval & Evaluation Cycle, and then click Run Now to apply the Group Policy Objects that are relevant to that client computer.

segment.source: Select Hardware Inventory Cycle, and then click Run Now.
segment.target: Select Hardware Inventory Cycle, and then click Run Now.

segment.source: This step runs the hardware inventory by using the new classes that you imported to your .mof files, and then sends the data to the Configuration Manager server.
segment.target: This step runs the hardware inventory by using the new classes that you imported to your .mof files, and then sends the data to the Configuration Manager server.

segment.source: In the Configuration Manager console, do the following:
segment.target: In the Configuration Manager console, do the following:

segment.source: In the navigation pane, right-click MBAM Supported Computers, click Update Membership, and then click Yes to force the client computer to report its membership immediately.
segment.target: In the navigation pane, right-click MBAM Supported Computers, click Update Membership, and then click Yes to force the client computer to report its membership immediately.

segment.source: In the navigation pane, click MBAM Supported Computers to verify that the client computer appears in the collection.
segment.target: In the navigation pane, click MBAM Supported Computers to verify that the client computer appears in the collection.

segment.source: On the client computer, in Control Panel, reopen Configuration Manager again, and do the following:
segment.target: On the client computer, in Control Panel, reopen Configuration Manager again, and do the following:

segment.source: Click the Actions tab, and then rerun Machine Policy Retrieval & Evaluation Cycle.
segment.target: Click the Actions tab, and then rerun Machine Policy Retrieval & Evaluation Cycle.

segment.source: Click the Configurations tab, select the BitLocker baseline, and then click Evaluate.
segment.target: Click the Configurations tab, select the BitLocker baseline, and then click Evaluate.

segment.source: In the Configuration Manager console, verify that the client computer appears on the Enterprise Compliance Report: as follows:
segment.target: In the Configuration Manager console, verify that the client computer appears on the Enterprise Compliance Report: as follows:

segment.source: In the navigation pane, select the Monitoring workspace.
segment.target: In the navigation pane, select the Monitoring workspace.

segment.source: In the console tree, expand OverviewReportingReportsMBAM.
segment.target: In the console tree, expand OverviewReportingReportsMBAM.

segment.source: Select the folder that represents the language in which you want to view reports, and then select the report in the results pane.
segment.target: Select the folder that represents the language in which you want to view reports, and then select the report in the results pane.

segment.source: Evaluating MBAM 2.5 by using the System Center Configuration Manager 2007 Integration topology
segment.target: Evaluating MBAM 2.5 by using the System Center Configuration Manager 2007 Integration topology

segment.source: To evaluate MBAM by using the Configuration Manager Integration topology, follow the same steps to install and configure MBAM in your test environment as you use in a production environment.
segment.target: To evaluate MBAM by using the Configuration Manager Integration topology, follow the same steps to install and configure MBAM in your test environment as you use in a production environment.

segment.source: After installing the MBAM Client on a client computer, complete the additional steps in this topic to enable the MBAM Client to start reporting the computer’s status to MBAM more quickly.
segment.target: After installing the MBAM Client on a client computer, complete the additional steps in this topic to enable the MBAM Client to start reporting the computer’s status to MBAM more quickly.

segment.source: To evaluate MBAM by using the Configuration Manager 2007 Integration topology
segment.target: To evaluate MBAM by using the Configuration Manager 2007 Integration topology

segment.target: Set the following registry keys to force the MBAM Client to wake up more quickly and at faster intervals:

segment.source: Restart the BitLocker Management Client Service.
segment.target: Restart the BitLocker Management Client Service.

segment.source: In Control Panel, open Configuration Manager, and then click the Actions tab.
segment.target: In Control Panel, open Configuration Manager, and then click the Actions tab.

segment.source: Select Machine Policy Retrieval & Evaluation Cycle, and then click Run Now to apply the Group Policy Objects that are relevant to that client computer.
segment.target: Select Machine Policy Retrieval & Evaluation Cycle, and then click Run Now to apply the Group Policy Objects that are relevant to that client computer.

segment.source: Select Hardware Inventory Cycle, and then click Run Now.
segment.target: Select Hardware Inventory Cycle, and then click Run Now.

segment.source: This step runs the hardware inventory by using the new classes that you imported to your .mof files and then sends the data to the Configuration Manager server.
segment.target: This step runs the hardware inventory by using the new classes that you imported to your .mof files and then sends the data to the Configuration Manager server.

segment.source: In the Configuration Manager console, do the following:
segment.target: In the Configuration Manager console, do the following:

segment.source: In the navigation pane, right-click MBAM Supported Computers, click Update Membership, and then click Yes to force the client computer to report its membership immediately.
segment.target: In the navigation pane, right-click MBAM Supported Computers, click Update Membership, and then click Yes to force the client computer to report its membership immediately.

segment.source: In the navigation pane, click MBAM Supported Computers to verify that the client computer appears in the collection.
segment.target: In the navigation pane, click MBAM Supported Computers to verify that the client computer appears in the collection.

segment.source: On the client computer, in Control Panel, reopen Configuration Manager again, and do the following:
segment.target: On the client computer, in Control Panel, reopen Configuration Manager again, and do the following:

segment.source: Click the Actions tab, and then rerun Machine Policy Retrieval & Evaluation Cycle.
segment.target: Click the Actions tab, and then rerun Machine Policy Retrieval & Evaluation Cycle.

segment.source: Click the Configurations tab, select the BitLocker baseline, and click Evaluate.
segment.target: Click the Configurations tab, select the BitLocker baseline, and click Evaluate.

segment.source: In the Configuration Manager console, verify that the client computer appears on the Enterprise Compliance Report, as follows
segment.target: In the Configuration Manager console, verify that the client computer appears on the Enterprise Compliance Report, as follows

segment.source: In the navigation pane, expand Computer ManagementReportingReporting Servicesserver nameMBAM.
segment.target: In the navigation pane, expand Computer ManagementReportingReporting Servicesserver nameMBAM.

segment.source: Within the MBAM node, select the folder that represents the language in which you want to view reports, and then select the report from the results pane.
segment.target: Within the MBAM node, select the folder that represents the language in which you want to view reports, and then select the report from the results pane.
